attributes.action: Issue parents with a badge to park in parent and Child parking spaces
attributes.additional_details:
There was an article published in Daily Express on 2.5.17 which confirms there are generally no rules for parking in these spaces although some supermarkets implement their own fines
Now I can confirm from experience that you cannot remove a baby in a car seat from a car parked in a standard space without damaging your car or the one next to you and trying to squeeze in to unbuckle a wriggling toddler is a joke. 
This spaces are a god send when you can use them so as parents let’s fight for them
attributes.background: Following the many arguments I have had with Child free people parking in a parent and Child parking space I have decided it’s time to act. I didn’t realise how abused these spaces were before becoming a Mum myself 3 years ago. It seems anyone and everyone believes they have the right to use them.

rejection.details:
Parking schemes and permits are usually the responsibility of your local council. If you'd like a scheme like this in your local area, then you could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

If you'd like the scheme to be available in the whole of the UK, you could start a petition asking for that.
